definition: variant of 贈予|赠予[zeng4 yu3]
to give as a present/to repel/to bestow an honorary title after death (old)

sentences.english: There are disputations about donator's right of revocation theoretically.
sentences.chinese: 理论上对赠与人撤销权制度的认识存在着极大的分歧。

sentences.english: A gift may be subject to obligations.
sentences.chinese: 第一百九十条赠与可以附义务。

sentences.english: The trustee must obey and carry out be directions of the settlor.
sentences.chinese: 受托人必须遵守并执行财产赠与人的指示。

sentences.english: He gave to his friends what he denned to his family.
sentences.chinese: 他宁可赠与朋友也不给家里人。

sentences.english: Tony Chan has always insisted that the Chinachem businesswoman left him her fortune.
sentences.chinese: 陈振聪一直坚持声称，华懋女商人将她的财产赠与他。

sentences.english: Best Regards To Daffy Tong and his Beloved Leslie Cheung.
sentences.chinese: 最好的祝愿赠与唐鹤德师长和他的挚爱张国荣师长。

sentences.english: Where the gift is subject to obligations, the donee shall perform his obligations in accordance with the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 赠与附义务的，受赠人应当按照约定履行义务。

sentences.english: In the case of a gift the thing itself passes to the donee.
sentences.chinese: 就赠与而言，赠物本身要交付给受赠人。

sentences.english: The second part analyses the nature of the bestowal contract.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，对赠与合同的性质进行了研究。

sentences.english: On the form of securities transfers of property levy estate or gift tax.
sentences.chinese: 对以证券形式转让的财产征收遗产税或赠与税。

sentences.english: He bequeathed his son a great fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他立遗嘱赠与儿子钜额的财产。

sentences.english: Dealing with donative when must want to pass notarial branch notarization.
sentences.chinese: 在办理赠与时，是必须要经过公证部门公证的。

sentences.english: The donative contract is typical contract in the Civil Law.
sentences.chinese: 在大陆法系各国民法中，赠与都是重要的有名合同。

sentences.english: Please donative me a young, let me during the long time take good care of him .
sentences.chinese: 请赠与我一个少年，让我在漫长的时光中好好爱护他。

sentences.english: The receiver is likely to feel resentful and to give as little as possible back to the giver.
sentences.chinese: 受赠者感觉憎恨，尽可能少地回报赠与者。

sentences.english: He bequeathed his son a great fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他立遗嘱赠与儿子巨额的财产。

definition: to give a present/to accord (a favor)/to grant
to lend/to put out a loan
restitution/return of something to its original owner/remittance

to agree on sth (after discussion)/to conclude a bargain/to arrange/to promise/to stipulate/to make an appointment/stipulated (time, amount, quality etc)/an arrangement/a deal/appointment/undertaking/commitment/understanding/engagement/stipulation
